page.title: 16LIVING IN CROWLE
page.content: {CROWLE}IS A SMALL{TOWN}WITH COUNCIL HOUSING, FLATS AND OLD PEOPLE'S DWELLINGS; PRIVATELY OWNED HOUSES AND BUNGALOWS; AND SOME FARM HOUSES AND COTTAGES. THERE ARE A FEW{SHOPS}TO CATER FOR LOCAL NEEDS, BUT PEOPLE GO ALSO INTO{SCUNTHORPE}OR{DONCASTER}. WHILST THERE IS A{BUS}SERVICE TO GOOLE AND SCUNTHORPE, AND A{STATION}AT EALAND ON THE CLEETHORPES-DONCASTER LINE, IN GENERAL FAMILIES NEED A CAR FOR WORK AND LEISURE. A SMALL PROPORTION OF ADULTS WORK LOCALLY IN INDUSTRY, FARMING OR SHOPS, BUT MOST WORK OUT OF CROWLE.{KEADBY {POWER STATION}EMPLOYED LOCALS BEFORE IT CLOSED. SOME RESIDENTS HAVE BEEN MADE REDUNDENT FROM{BRITISH STEEL}AT SCUNTHORPE. {CROWLE TOWN COUNCIL}MEET REGULARLY TO DISCUSS PLANNING.{HUMBERSIDE}IS THE COUNTY COUNCIL FOR CROWLE.
